𒀀𒇉 𒌓𒄒𒉣 ÍD.Buranun/Purattu
→ Hebrew: פְּרָת
→ Elamite: 𒌑𒅁𒊏𒌅𒅖 (ú-ip-ra-tu-iš) (perhaps)
→ Old Persian: 𐎢𐎳𐎼𐎠𐎬𐎢 (u-f-r-a-tu-u /Ufrātu/)

𒄷𒁓 Hubur Euphrates "watercourse" or "netherworld"
𒄩𒀀𒁉𒅖 /ḫāpis/ river (Luwian) PIE *h₂ep: āp “water” अप् áp “water”
𐎠𐎱𐎡𐎹𐎠 apiyā 𒄩𒉺𒀀 ḫa-pa-a, “towards the water/river”

Hapiru™ vs Euphrat

𓎛 𓂝 𓊪 𓏮 𓈘 | Hapy, the Nile | 𓎛 𓊪 𓈘 | Nile |

EU ⇔ 𒀀𒀀𒋻 µWater 𓈗 EAU
EU ⇔ 𒀀𒇉 ÍD.r 𓇋 𓏏 𓂋 𓈘 water
EU ⇔ 𒀀𒀸𒋗𒍑 āššuš •yd…? good

The 𒌓 in Euphrates nees some explanation, since there is no variant of sun with B/P!

reanalysis of with different bindings:
𒀀𒇉𒌓𒄒𒉣
𒀀𒇉 𒌓𒄒 𒉣 river of Buranun/Purattu (NOT supported by standard readings of 𒌓/𒄒)
𒀀𒇉 𒌓𒄒 𒉣 river of Buranun/Purattu, supported by compound reading of 𒌓𒄒 as fruit
𒀀𒇉𒌓 𒄒 𒉣 water of waters
𒀀𒇉𒌓 𒄒 𒉣 river of fruits
𒀀𒇉 𒌓𒄒 𒉣 river of rivers
𒀀𒇉 𒌓𒄒 𒉣 river of grandeur 𓅨 𓂋 𓈘 𓈇 𓏤
𒀀𒇉 𒌓𒄒 𒉣 river of birds 𓅨 𓂋 𓈘 𓈇 𓏤
𒀀𒇉 𒌓𒄒 𒉣 river 𒌓𒄒 ⲟⲩⲧⲁϩ (fruit) ⇔ Uta 𒌓

the longest version might be the most insightful

𓄲 𓂋 𓂻 𓅨 𓂋 𓈘 𓈇 𓏤 Euphrates ⇔
𓇆 𓅨 𓂋 𓈘 the Great Green (Sea/River)
𓇆 𓅨 𓂋 𓇋 𓈗 𓈘 𓈅 𓏤 the Sea

Euphrates Vs Tigris
𒀀𒇉𒌓𒄒𒉣 vs 𒀀𒇉𒈦𒄘𒃼

LeoPard 𓃮 vs Tiger

Pard 𓃮 + n 𒉣 => panther
